titleInfo.title: Letter, Southgate Cregmile in Chattanooga, Tenn. to Crittenden Cregmile, 1863, November 1

mods.abstract: 1863 November 1 Southgate Cregmile in Chattanooga, Tenn., to his brother Crittenden. Acknowledges receiving his letter and assures him that all the hometown boys are well. Discusses the layout of the camp and its vulnerability to enemy fire. Describes Gen. Longstreet's men as cleverly wearing blue uniforms just like theirs; but, on the other hand, also emphasizes the fact that Gen. Bragg's men have located their cannons too far out of range to do any damage. Makes note of his brigade's new picket schedule. Thanks him for the photo he sent of himself and asks that their brother Magnum send one of himself as well. Asks him to write soon.
